definition.name: ins

text.english:
Let \( \texttt {ins} : \mathbb{N} \times \ {BT}_\mathbb{N} \to {BT}_\mathbb{N} \) be defied as follows:
  • Base Clause: \( \texttt{ins}(n,\lambda) = N(\lambda,n,\lambda) \)
  • Inductive Clause: \( \texttt{ins}(n, N(t_1,m,t_2)) = \begin{cases} N(\texttt{ins}(n,t_1),m,t_2) & \text{ if } n \le m \\ N(t_1,m,\texttt{ins}(n,t_2)) & \text{ otherwise } \end{cases} \).
text.italiano:
Sia \( \texttt {ins} : \mathbb{N} \times \ {BT}_\mathbb{N} \to {BT}_\mathbb{N} \) definita come segue:
  • Clausola Base: \( \texttt{ins}(n,\lambda) = N(\lambda,n,\lambda) \)
  • Clausola Induttiva: \( \texttt{ins}(n, N(t_1,m,t_2)) = \begin{cases} N(\texttt{ins}(n,t_1),m,t_2) & \text{ se } n \le m \\ N(t_1,m,\texttt{ins}(n,t_2)) & \text{ altrimenti } \end{cases} \).

definition.coq: Fixpoint ins (n : nat) (t : bte nat) : bte nat := match t with | lmd => N lmd n lmd | N t1 m t2 => #cases N (ins n t1) m t2 #if n <=? m #otherwise N t1 m (ins n t2) #endcases end.

theorems.name: ins_base_clause

text.english:
Base clause of definition of \(\texttt{ins}\):


\[ \forall n \in \mathbb{N} .\; \texttt{ins}(n, \lambda) = N(\lambda,n,\lambda) \]
text.italiano:
Clausola base della definizione di \(\texttt{ins}\):


\[ \forall n \in \mathbb{N} .\; \texttt{ins}(n, \lambda) = N(\lambda,n,\lambda) \]

theorems.coq:
Theorem ins_base_clause : forall n : nat , ins n lmd = N lmd n lmd.
Proof.
reflexivity.
Qed.

theorems.name: ins_inductive_clause

text.english:
Inductive clause of the definition of \(\texttt{ins}\):

\[ \forall n \in \mathbb{N} .\; \forall t_1,t_2 \in {BT}_\mathbb{N} .\; \forall m \in \mathbb{N} .\; \texttt{ins}(n, N(t_1,m,t_2)) = \begin{cases} N(\texttt{ins}(n,t_1),m,t_2) & \text{ se } n \le m \\ N(t_1,m,\texttt{ins}(n,t_2)) & \text{ altrimenti } \end{cases} \]
text.italiano:
Clausola induttiva della definizione di \(\texttt{ins}\):

\[ \forall n \in \mathbb{N} .\; \forall t_1,t_2 \in {BT}_\mathbb{N} .\; \forall m \in \mathbb{N} .\; \texttt{ins}(n, N(t_1,m,t_2)) = \begin{cases} N(\texttt{ins}(n,t_1),m,t_2) & \text{ se } n \le m \\ N(t_1,m,\texttt{ins}(n,t_2)) & \text{ altrimenti } \end{cases} \]

theorems.coq:
Theorem ins_inductive_clause : forall (t1 t2 : bte nat) (n m : nat) , ins n (N t1 m t2) =  if n <=? m then N (ins n t1) m t2 else N t1 m (ins n t2).
Proof.
reflexivity.
Qed.
